meanings.definition: A fixed amount of a commodity officially allowed to each person during a time of shortage, as in wartime.
meanings.sent1: During the war, each soldier received a daily ration of food.
meanings.sent2: The government distributed rations to ensure everyone had enough to eat.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be soldiers, dividing their snacks into rations for the 'battle'.
meanings.sent4: In the story, hope was the ration that kept the characters going through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The image of the soldier sharing his ration with a hungry child touched everyone's hearts.

meanings.definition: To restrict the consumption of (a commodity) by fixing a certain amount per person.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to ration the candy to make sure each student got a fair share.
meanings.sent2: During the drought, the town had to ration water to conserve resources.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had to ration their screen time to avoid arguments.
meanings.sent4: She had to ration her energy throughout the day to complete all her tasks.
meanings.sent5: The coach had to ration playing time among the team to give everyone a chance to participate.
